channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bottles and other litter in playground, 19th September
item.description:
The playground on Setchell Estate and area around it is strewn with litter. Adult males are sitting and drinking alcohol in the playground and leaving bottles on the ground and in hedge. This is a recurring problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fort Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inadequate rubbish management, 19th September
item.description:
Yet again the Drs Surgeries on Theydon Road are not managing their outside space. Itâ€™s a health hazard to people and animals. Rats and foxes scavenging. More rubbish being dumped daily. Trip hazards. Large boxes on floor.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 19th September
item.description:
We once again have fly tipping outside and rubbish strewn across the entrance to our flat. Our bin area needs to be contained. When will Hackney council take this seriously? It poses a health and safety risk and encourages pests.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
